oai_dc:dc.dc:descriptions: In the discourse there is imbedded a fable about the knorhaan, relating to how its head was burnt in the fire; but this requires further explanation. (L II.

416.) The Korhaan Malkop marries his elder sister, who carries him like a child to deceive others into thinking he is a child, even though he is her husband. The Korhaan knocks down the Steenbok (his brother
law), who plunges the 'child's' head into the fire to punish him. The Korhaan screams and flies up into the sky. The brother
law says that the Korhaan Malkop must always be marked by fire and must marry a female whose head is marked in the same manner.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Korhaan marries his elder sister (the Anteater's laws) (||kabbo's version 2)
